result.execSummary:
The defendant Irie L Cleasant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: count two in 15CF49, but consecutive to any other sentence. Release for the Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
Conditions of probation are as to counts one, two, three and four.

miscConds.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT, ONE, TWO, THREE AND FOUR:  Must pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge during the course of probation to the probation agent.  Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil  judgment to be entered.
Seek and maintain full time work and/or school.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.
Mental health evaluation and any recommended treatment. Court recommends Trauma Informed Care.

No alcohol. 
 No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant may only possess a valid prescription for herself or for any of her children.    Must notify  probation agent of all prescriptions for herself and children within 48 hours of receiving the presciption and must fill all prescriptions validly obtained for herself and children at one pharmacy.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Irie L Cleasant in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Irie L Cleasant in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3 & 4  - 
The defendant was advised of her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent to Count 2 in 15CF49, but consecutive to any sentence; release for the Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments; credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 24 MONTHS with the below conditions.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent to Count 1 in 15CF49, but consecutive to any sentence; release for the Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments; credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 24 MONTHS with the below conditions.
AS TO COUNT 3:
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent to Count 4 in 15CF49, but consecutive to any sentence; release for the Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments; credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 24 MONTHS with the below conditions.
AS TO COUNT  4:
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent to Count 3 in 15CF49, but consecutive to any sentence; release for the Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments; credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 24 MONTHS with the below conditions.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION as to COUNTS 1, 2, 3, and 4:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed. Defendant
  may only possess a  valid prescription for herself or for any of her children.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Defendant must notify probation agent of all prescriptions for herself and children within 48 hours of receiving the prescription and must fill all prescriptions validly obtained for herself and children at one pharmacy.
- Seek and maintain full time work and/or school.
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. Court recommends Trauma Informed Care. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 


AS TO EACH COUNT 1, 2, 3, & 4: Defendant must pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. 
Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Character letters submitted by the Defense, received and filed. 
Scanned, hard copy of the letters are in file 15CF49.
Psychological Evaluation filed by Defense Attorney Darryl Smith, received and filed.

Defendant Irie L Cleasant in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Irie L Cleasant in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense request case be set for Plea and Sentencing. Case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 3-19-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Irie L Cleasant in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Irie L Cleasant in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Arraignment scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DEMARA C.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Irie L Cleasant in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Irie L Cleasant in custody.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge STARK, Branch 17.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
